definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: Two boats managed to get away and eventually hit upon the desert island of Trebucket .
sentences.chinese: 兩條小艇離開了沉船，最後來到特里巴克特這座荒島。

sentences.english: The third chapter is entitled "Analysis on Claims against Wreck Removal Fee and Clear-up Fee".
sentences.chinese: 第三章，沉船清障費用及清污費用債權分析。

sentences.english: The sinking ship carried down with her the captain and many passengers.
sentences.chinese: 沉船使船長和許多乘客葬身海底。

sentences.english: Claire Bowes reports on the sinking of the Rainbow Warrior.
sentences.chinese: 克萊爾鮑伊斯在“彩虹勇士號”的沉船處爲您報道。

sentences.english: They were in the saloon of a sinking ship, looking up at him through the darkening water.
sentences.chinese: 她們困在沉船客艙裏，透過發暗的水體凝望他。

sentences.english: Burning and secondary explosions of wrecks.
sentences.chinese: 二次燃燒和爆炸的沉船。

sentences.english: Every sunken ship has a chart.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一艘沉船是不備有圖表的。
沉船島南部海面的曼尼。

sentences.english: Causes of the sinking are still unknown.
He was awarded his damages in the shipwreck by the court.
sentences.chinese: 法院判給他沉船事故中的損失賠償費。

sentences.english: I have collided with submerged wreck.
The report notes that he had not used any safety line for the wreck penetration.
sentences.chinese: 報告指出他穿越沉船時沒有使用任何安全線。

sentences.english: Se Nuding sinking cause of the accident did not say.
sentences.chinese: 塞努丁沒有說明沉船事故的原因。

sentences.english: The eel slithered in and out of the sunken ship.
sentences.chinese: 這條鰻魚在這艘沉船裏遊進游出。

sentences.english: Dean had no memories of the sinking and said she preferred it that way.
sentences.chinese: 迪安對沉船沒有任何記憶，並說她很高興能夠這樣。

sentences.english: A thousand sails pass by the wrecked ship; ten thousand saplings shoot up beyond the withered tree.
sentences.chinese: 沉船的旁邊正有千帆駛過，病樹的前頭卻是萬木爭春。

definition: to salvage/to dredge/to fish out (person or object from the sea)
(of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
(of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
